intro: Ptilotus spathulatus, commonly known as the narrow-leaved spinifex, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its compact, mat-forming growth habit. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish or reddish in color. Its leaves are narrow and often covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss in arid environments. Ptilotus spathulatus is well adapted to sandy soils and is often found in coastal and inland regions of Australia.
